author: NewsBreak Original
title: UNESCO awards press prize to Palestinian journalists in Gaza
text:
By AFP ,
1 hour ago
UNESCO on Thursday awarded its world press freedom prize to all Palestinian journalists covering the war in Gaza, where Israel has been battling Hamas for more than six months.
"In these times of darkness and hopelessness, we wish to share a strong message of solidarity and recognition to those Palestinian journalists who are covering this crisis in such dramatic circumstances," said Mauricio Weibel, chair of the international jury of media professionals.
"As humanity, we have a huge debt to their courage and commitment to freedom of expression."
Audrey Azoulay, director general at the UN organisation for education, science and culture, said the prize paid "tribute to the courage of journalists facing difficult and dangerous circumstances".
According to the New York-based Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ), at least 97 members of the press have been killed since the war broke out in October, 92 of whom were Palestinians.
The war started with Hamas's unprecedented October 7 attack on Israel that resulted in the deaths of 1,170 people, mostly civilians, according to an AFP tally of Israeli official figures.
Israel estimates that 129 captives seized by militants during their attack remain in Gaza. The military says 34 of them are dead.
Israel's retaliatory offensive against Hamas has killed at least 34,596 people in Gaza, mostly women and children, according to the Hamas-run territory's health ministry.
jf/bc/imm

author: Héctor González
title: Alerta por ola de frío: Madrid eleva al nivel 2 el riesgo por bajas temperaturas
text: Ante la previsión meteorológica para los próximas días, que apunta a temperaturas mínimas por debajo de los 0 grados centígrados en buena parte de la región, la Comunidad de Madrid ha elevado la alerta por riesgo, pasando del nivel 1 al 2. El segundo nivel del protocolo de actuación frente a bajas temperaturas indica un riesgo alto para la salud de la población por ola de frío, por lo que el Gobierno regional hace un llamamiento general a la población para extremar la precaución, con especial atención en el caso de mayores, enfermos crónicos o niños. En su página web, el Ejecutivo autonómico ofrece una serie de recomendaciones a seguir durante las jornadas de mayor frío, sobre todo por los grupos de riesgo. El \"frío intenso puede producir efectos perjudiciales para la salud de las personas\", señala la Comunidad, ya que \"agrava las enfermedades cardiovasculares y respiratorias, la sintomatología de las enfermedades reumáticas y favorece los resfriados, las infecciones bronquiales y la gripe\". Unos efectos más marcados en los grupos más vulnerables, como son \"las personas mayores, las personas con dolencias crónicas (cardíacas, respiratorias, adicción al alcohol, etc.), los bebés, y las personas sin hogar o que viven en hogares con deficientes condiciones\". Para todos ellos, es conveniente seguir una serie de recomendaciones, como conservar el calor en el hogar, evitar riesgos con los sistemas de calefacción, evitar quedarse quieto mucho tiempo y estar atentos a los demás.

author: Oliver Adey
title: Paralympic Games: Para cycling road brings eleven of the twelve new medals for France
text:
PARIS, Sept 4 (Reuters) – Para-cycling road racing swept the Paris Paralympic Games on Wednesday, with France claiming 11 of the day’s 12 medals in time trials.
France has 50 medals, including 15 gold.
There were four of them who won the Paralympic title on Wednesday: Alexandre Léauté, Kévin Le Cunff, Thomas Peyroton-Dartet and Mathieu Bosredon.
Accustomed to gold medals on the track, Alexandre Léauté won his first title on the road in the C2 category. He now has seven Paralympic medals, including three gold. The Breton will have the opportunity on Saturday in the C1-3 road race to win a fourth medal at these Paris Games.
Kévin Le Cunff took his revenge on his teammate Gatien Le Rousseau. Beaten for bronze last Saturday by his compatriot, he this time beat him in a nice French double in the C4 category to win his first medal in these Paris Games, the second gold of his career.
The French achieved another double in the H3 category with Mathieu Bosredon’s first Paralympic title ahead of Johan Quaile, silver medalist for his first Games.
Thomas Peyroton-Dartet reached his first Paralympic podium, and on the top step, dominating the C3 time trial.
In addition to Gatien Le Rousseau and Johan Quaile, three other Frenchmen were awarded silver: Heïdi Gaugain in category C5, Elie de Carvalho (with his guide Mickaël Guichard) in category B and Loïc Vergnaud in category H5.
Finally, Florian Jouanny and Dorian Foulon won bronze, respectively in the H2 and C5 categories.
The only medal on Wednesday that was not won by para road cycling was won by para table tennis. Defeated in the MS2 singles semi-final by the Czech Jiri Suchanek (3-1), Fabien Lamirault had to settle for the bronze medal, distributed to the two losers in the last four.
A member of the quintet that lit the cauldron at the opening ceremony, Fabien Lamirault was the double title holder in his category. (Report by Vincent Daheron, edited by Blandine Hénault)

FTC's Holyoak concerned AI collecting children's data
FILE PHOTO: Federal Trade Commission seal is seen at a news conference at FTC Headquarters in Washington, U.S., July 24, 2019. REUTERS/Yuri Gripas/File Photo
15 Nov 2024 06:03AM (Updated: 15 Nov 2024 06:33AM) Bookmark Bookmark Share WhatsApp Telegram Facebook Twitter Email LinkedIn WASHINGTON : U.S. Federal Trade Commissioner Melissa Holyoak said on Thursday the agency should look into how artificial-intelligence products use the data they gather from younger users, amid privacy and safety concerns.
Holyoak, one of two Republicans on the commission who could end up as its acting chair after President-elect Donald Trump takes office in January, said the agency should review what authority it has to gather information about AI privacy practices regarding children.
The former Utah solicitor general gave the example of kids using AI services in the way older generations looked to a Magic 8 Ball fortune-telling toy, asking, "should I go to the dance?"
"Who is collecting that? Who has that information? Where is that information going?" Holyoak said during a speech at an American Bar Association antitrust meeting in Washington.
The FTC enforces the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act, which regulates how platforms collect younger users' data, and has sued TikTok over alleged violations.
The FTC is headed for a shakeup when its current chair, Lina Khan, steps down or is replaced by a Trump-appointed successor. Khan's fight against corporate consolidation in the name of consumers won fans among Democrats and some Republicans, including Vice President-elect JD Vance. But she has drawn criticism from some in the business community over her aggressive approach.
Khan has said that greater scrutiny of deals deters mergers that would illegally harm competition.
Holyoak said the FTC should not take a dogmatic approach towards mergers and acquisitions.
"We are not in the business of trying to stop deals to just stop deals," she said.
Holyoak also said she thinks the FTC will lose its appeal defending the worker noncompete ban. Holyoak did not comment on vocal support for the ban from former U.S. Representative Matt Gaetz, Trump's pick for attorney general.
"I think we all could benefit from the court and the Supreme Court weighing in on this issue," she said.
Source: Reuters Sign up for our newsletters Get our pick of top stories and thought-provoking articles in your inbox

author: Ramón Morales
title: Quedan \"intransitables\" varios accesos a El Rocío y dos calles por la DANA
text: Temporal en Andalucía Quedan "intransitables" varios accesos a El Rocío y dos calles por la DANA Ya en Almonte, se han cortado los accesos que cruzan el arroyo Santa María y los accesos que cruzan el arroyo de la Moriana y el Regajo de los Serranos [Sigue en DIRECTO todas las incidencias de la DANA en Andalucía](https://www.elcorreoweb.es/sociedad/2024/11/01/directo-incidencias-dana-paso-andalucia-110815981.html) Siguen los [problemas en Huelva por el paso de la DANA](/andalucia/2024/11/01/bomberos-recatan-mujer-atrapada-huelva- 586.html), que ha dejado en aviso rojo la provincia hasta las 15.00 horas y a partir de ahi en naranja. Una de las incidencias ha tenido lugar en la aldea de El Rocío, perteneciente al municipio de Almonte, en el que se han cortado varios accesos y dos calles al quedar "intransitables". Según ha indicado el cuerpo policial en sus cuentas de redes sociales, se ha procedido a los cortes de la calle Villamanrrique y calle Muñoz y Pavón de la aldea almonteña, así como se han cortado los accesos que cruzan el arroyo Caño Marín. Asimismo, ya en Almonte, se han cortado los accesos que cruzan el arroyo Santa María --camino de La Cerca-- y los accesos que cruzan el arroyo de la Moriana y el Regajo de los Serranos --camino de Los Serranos--. De otro lado, el Ayuntamiento ha informado de que ciudadanos del municipio están llevando a cabo la recogida de alimentos no perecederos, ropa de abrigo y productos de higiene para los damnificados por la DANA en Valencia. En este sentido, el Consistorio se ha puesto a la "entera disposición" de los mismos "para colaborar" con la entrega de estos materiales a Valencia, "que se hará efectiva este próximo lunes 4 de noviembre, y ha pedido que los enseres donados se entreguen en el almacén Doñana Fresa, que será el punto de salida. Las personas que quieran colaborar pueden llamar al número de teléfono 685 996 378.
